message: Just wondering what people think of this
Looks great.  Hope its beneficial for everyone!
@dramatica So far, so good.
Posted on the Dramatica forums at screenplay.com about this place
Hi Guys, Buck here. Looks like a good resource.
If you're new or want to introduce yourself or just want to try it out and see how this works feel free to post whatever in this thread

I like this better than the previous chat system. Although it's ideal of the messages are concise, it can accommodate posts with reasonable content. Additionally, it's asynchronous, meaning that I don't have to be online to read what others have shared.
Agreed - kind of the best parts of a forum and chat and twitter combined
same situation
Yes, and there were things I didn't share -- like story specifics -- because of that.
Yeah, but there were a couple hundred on the MailList, so its the same thing
Is there any way to see who the six members are?
Oh, well. I'm not a huge fan of lurkers.
I don't have anything specific to talk about just now, so no.
That's actually the best of both worlds then.
you want me to?
No
you mean a new topic? just click "create a new topic" upper right
we can always start a private group if there are specifics you want to get into
I managed to create a group, but now I started a topic
But I'm going to start a group to ask a different question. This will take me a sec.
This did not work. How can I create a group in "Dramatica" ... a sub-group, I guess
Jim, if you start a closed-group where story specifics can be shared, I would like to be included in it.
I think Mike wanted to talk about his story with me in private.
@Buck Yeah, Jim has intimate details about my stories that I wouldn't feel comfortable sharing.
Has anyone else had problems with the auto-screen refresh?
I find that everything generally works fine if I have any chat up on the screen. If I'm just at the homepage, then yes.
I refreshed my page, and you came back,  @Chris_Huntley

As far as when chatting with someone, no.  I do notice you blink on and off as being online.  But whenever someone posts something I get a red 1 symbol up next to groups that tells me there is a new message.  I don't necessarily have to hit refresh.  Sometimes to see who's in the room
Chris, you just disappeared.

Jim, having experienced this system for a few days now, I find that I like it much better than the previous chat. The primary reason is because it sends me an e-mail of the conversations. Thank you for finding this and setting it up.
No problem.  Its still rough in a few places but could turn out to be a good resource.
Profile Name (upper right area of screen) > Edit Your Profile > Settings > Notifications
You get an e-mail of the conversations? I don't.
When someone starts a new conversation you should get an email about it
I get the "new convo" e-mail, but that's it for now.
It looks like if only the topic of a thread is entered and no body, then no e-mail notification is sent to subscribers.
